name: create-subject-fod-map
label: createSubjectFODMap: Make FOD image from HCP-diff output
description: This gear uses multi-shell HCP-diff output archive to calculate FOD images. The details of MRtrix spherical deconvolution method can be found here: mrtrix.readthedocs.io. If you use the adaptive convex optimization method please cite the following paper: Tran G, Shi Y. Adaptively constrained convex optimization for accurate fiber orientation estimation with high order spherical harmonics. Med Image Comput Comput Assist Interv. 2013;16(Pt 3):485-492. doi:10.1007/978-3-642-40760-4_61, Also with this gear DTI metrics (e.g MD,FA) can be calculated. FSL's DTIfit is used for this operation.

hcp_diff_archive.description: HCP-diff archive that contains preprocessed HCP images.

response_csf.description: CSF response function. Use this if you are using a unique function. If empty it will be calculated from the data

response_gm.description: Gray matter response function. Use this if you are using a unique function. If empty it will be calculated from the data

response_wm.description: White matter response function. Use this if you are using a unique function. If empty it will be calculated from the data

convexOpt-MaxNumFiberCrossingPerVoxel.description: The maximum number of assumed fiber crossings per voxel

convexOpt-NoiseFloor.description: Minumum magnitude of peaks considered as a fiber direction

method.description: Method to use for FOD creation. Or calculate DTI measures.

mrTrix-lmax.description: the maximum spherical harmonic order for the output FOD(s).For algorithms with multiple outputs, this should be provided as a comma-separated list of integers, one for each output image; for single-output algorithms, only a single integer should be provided. If omitted, the command will use the lmax of the corresponding response function (i.e based on its number of coefficients), up to a maximum of 8.

author: Ozenc Taskin
source: https://www.mrtrix.org/, Tran, G. and Shi, Y. (2015). Fiber orientation and compartment parameter estimation from multi-shell diffusion imaging. IEEE Transactions on Medical Imaging, 34(11), 2320â€“2332.
